concept.title: Understanding the Family Education Rights and Privacy (FERPA)FERPA
concept.shortdesc: Under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), you have the right to restrict all or part of your directory information, which includes your preferred email, your enrollment status (full-time/part-time), major field of study, and more.

conbody.p: The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) protects students' privacy of their education records. FERPA applies to schools and agencies that recieve funding from the US Department of Education
Parents and students can request access and review of their education records, and request amendment to those records if the information is found to be inconsistent, innaccurate, or misleading.
If you wish to restrict this information, you can do so in your MyPack Portal:
You can control the information you grant access others to by clicking Restrictin the Personal Information section of the MyPack portal.

If you choose a Full Privacy Block, you can grant exceptions for certain publications by clicking the Full Privacy Block field, checking the Restricted box, and selecting the Exceptions you would like to grant

By selecting a a “full privacy” block to prevent us from sharing your information with anyone, including employers. A full privacy block also prevents your inclusion in graduation and Dean’s List publications.
This information aligns in accordance with REG 11.00.01: Family Education Rights and Privacy (FERPA)
